comment.text: A long-chain (S)-3-hydroxyacyl-CoA + NAD(+) = a long-chain 3-oxoacyl-CoA + NADH.
Octamer of 4 alpha (HADHA) and 4 beta (HADHB) subunits.

isoform.text: No experimental confirmation available. May be produced at very low levels due to a premature stop codon in the mRNA, leading to nonsense-mediated mRNA decay.

disease.name: Mitochondrial trifunctional protein deficiency
disease.description: A disease biochemically characterized by loss of all enzyme activities of the mitochondrial trifunctional protein complex. Variable clinical manifestations include hypoglycemia, cardiomyopathy, delayed psychomotor development, sensorimotor axonopathy, generalized weakness, hepatic dysfunction, respiratory failure. Sudden infant death may occur. Most patients die from heart failure.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.

disease.name: Long-chain 3-hydroxyl-CoA dehydrogenase deficiency
disease.description: The clinical features are very similar to TFP deficiency. Biochemically, LCHAD deficiency is characterized by reduced long-chain 3-hydroxyl-CoA dehydrogenase activity, while the other enzyme activities of the TFP complex are normal or only slightly reduced.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.

disease.name: Maternal acute fatty liver of pregnancy
disease.description: Severe maternal illness occurring during pregnancies with affected fetuses. This disease is associated with LCHAD deficiency and characterized by sudden unexplained infant death or hypoglycemia and abnormal liver enzymes (Reye-like syndrome).

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.
In the N-terminal section; belongs to the enoyl-CoA hydratase/isomerase family.
In the central section; belongs to the 3-hydroxyacyl-CoA dehydrogenase family.
